oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The history of Country Music - Volume 2 - Recording 1 - Side 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Country music history program with voice overs and commercial recordings likely for radio broadcast. Internet sources say the producer and narrator is Lee Cash. Subject matter pertains to the history of country music and recording is likely a syndicated radio show. Tape is labeled as: volume two, recording one, side one.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) The History of Country Music (Unconfirmed) ([Unidentified]) -- (00:03) An unidentified speaker discusses "Satisfied Mind" -- (00:18) Satisfied Mind (Porter Wagoner) -- (03:01) An unidentified speaker introduces Don Gibson -- (03:20) Gibson discusses performing "Oh Lonesome Me" at a club -- (03:35) Oh Lonesome Me (Don Gibson) -- (05:58) An unidentified speaker discusses 1958 and "Three Bells" -- (06:27) Three Bells (Browns) -- (09:11) An unidentified speaker introduces Jim Reeves -- (09:23) Mexican Joe (Jim Reeves) -- (11:55) Jim Reeves reflect on the first Jimmie Rodgers' recording he heard and its influence -- (13:00) An unidentified speaker discusses Reeves' death and influence -- (13:28) He'll Have to Go (Jim Reeves) -- (15:37) An unidentified speaker reflects on Jimmy Dean's "Big Bad John" -- (16:01) Big Bad John (Jimmy Dean) -- (19:21) An unidentified speaker introduces Bobby Bare -- (19:28) Bare reflects on how he discovered "Detroit City" -- (20:18) Detroit City (Bobby Bare) -- (22:49) The History of Country Music (Unconfirmed) ([Unidentified])
